docs.lead_paragraph: Pre-existing condition insurance plans, mandated by the new health care law, opened for business last July, but many consumers still have no idea they exist, reports Walecia Konrad in this week's Patient Money column.
docs.abstract: Pre-existing condition insurance plans, mandated by the new health care law, opened for business last July, but many consumers still have no idea they exist, reports Walecia Konrad in this week's Patient Money column.
docs.snippet: Pre-existing condition insurance plans, mandated by the new health care law, opened for business last July, but many consumers still have no idea they exist, reports Walecia Konrad in this week's Patient Money column.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bryson Voirin, a doctoral student at the Max Planck Institute for Ornithology in Germany and a fellow at the Smithsonian Tropical Research Institute in Panama, writes from Panama, where he is studying sleep in wild frigate birds.
docs.abstract: Researchers studying sleep in wild animals started with a surprisingly difficult subject: the three-toed sloth.
docs.snippet: Researchers studying sleep in wild animals started with a surprisingly difficult subject: the three-toed sloth.

docs.lead_paragraph: There's a bipartisan consensus that the only politically plausible path to entitlement reform requires maintaining the existing level of benefits for current retirees, and then easing the system in a more sustainable direction for the under-55 population. Politically plausible, but also obviously unfair, for the reasons David Frum suggests here:
docs.abstract: The Ryan roadmap and the inevitable unfairness of reform.
docs.snippet: The Ryan roadmap and the inevitable unfairness of reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: It probably tells us something that the hearing that began in Washington this morning, before the health subcommittee of the House Energy and Commerce Committee, is the very first congressional hearing on the Class Act.

headline.main: The Curtain Rises on the Class Act

docs.abstract: Regulators have begun to float details on the implementation of the Class Act.
docs.snippet: Regulators have begun to float details on the implementation of the Class Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: Buddy Roemer, the former Republican governor of Louisiana, is eager to be an outspoken, sharp-edged irritant to members of his own party, casting them as bought and paid for by the special interests in Washington.

headline.main: Roemer to Run as Irritant to Republicans in 2012

docs.abstract: Buddy Roemer, the former Republican governor of Louisiana, is planning a run for president.
docs.snippet: Buddy Roemer, the former Republican governor of Louisiana, is planning a run for president.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several states have experienced serious wrangling over the rights of public-sector union employees and the benefits they receive. One of the questions at issue now is whether those workers will be able to maintain middle-class status if changes are made to union workers' pay. What does the term "middle class" mean to you?

headline.main: What Does 'Middle Class' Mean to You?

docs.abstract: Student Opinion | What things represent middle-class life, and, in turn, what does being part of the middle class represent?
docs.snippet: Student Opinion | What things represent middle-class life, and, in turn, what does being part of the middle class represent?

docs.lead_paragraph: Blue Shield’s decision did not quiet discussion in California on giving the state the ability to simply block rate increases at health insurers.

headline.seo: Blue Shield of California to Forgo Rate Increase

docs.snippet: Blue Shield’s decision did not quiet discussion in California on giving the state the ability to simply block rate increases at health insurers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Blue Shield of California, a nonprofit health insurer, said on Wednesday that it would no longer seek a rate increase this year for individuals who buy coverage on their own rather than through an employer.

headline.main: California Insurer Retreats on Raising Rates

docs.abstract: Blue Shield of California withdraws its request for a rate increase.
docs.snippet: Blue Shield of California withdraws its request for a rate increase.
